page.title: 14Recreation: Sports & Walking
page.content: Public footpaths criss-cross the downland and provide many splendid country walks. The most used and well-known path is the South Downs Way which runs along the top of the Downs from Eastbourne to Winchester, 90 miles away. As all the downland is owned by the Corporation, there is growing public pressure that it should be used for recreation. Perhaps in 30 years time there will be no more farming in this area and the public will have all their land back. There are 2 golf-courses in the area: 'the Royal Eastbourne' and 'the Downs'. Both are well-used and an attraction for visitors to the area. Recently hang-gliding has become very popular and the Downs provide an ideal situation for the gliders, when the wind blows from the sea.
